title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | SB 1.17.23 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 04-03-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: The material energy is always provoking doubts about the supreme authority of the Lord.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the inconceivable nature of the Lord's energies, the role of Maya, and how a devotee should not blame others or the Lord for difficulties, understanding the chain of cause and effect and the influence of past karma.

segments.key_quote: I wish to see your illusory potency, by whose influence the entire world, together with its ruling demigods, consider reality to be materially variegated.
segments.summary: This segment introduces the story of Markandeya Rishi, who prayed to see the Lord's illusory energy in action, highlighting his detachment from material benefits and his desire to understand Maya's influence.

segments.key_quote: Even as Markandeya looked on, the rain pouring down from the clouds filled the ocean more and more and more until the great sea covered up the earth's islands, mountains, continents.
segments.summary: This segment describes the devastating flood created by the Lord's illusory energy, showing Markandeya Rishi's experience of fear, hunger, and disorientation as he wandered through the deluge.

segments.key_quote: Suddenly the child inhaled everything and Markandeya found himself within the body of the child.
segments.summary: This segment narrates Markandeya Rishi's encounter with the infant Vata Patra Shayi, his experience of being inside the Lord's body, and his eventual return to his ashram, illustrating the power and mystery of the Lord's illusory energy.
